title: Teen faces multiple charges after Duncan shooting
content:
DUNCAN, SC (FOX Carolina) -
A teen faces multiple charges after a male was shot in the face in Duncan Wednesday.
Dispatch said the shooting was reported at Sunny Ray Drive around 5:45 p.m.
Duncan Police Chief C.E. Long said the victim survived and told officers that he had been accidentally shot in the face with a .22 revolver when he and another person were playing with the gun.
Police said 17-year-old Roque Ricardo Deleon Jr. fired the shot and then ran from the scene.
Deleon was captured and charged with attempted murder, unlawful carry and discharging a firearm.
Police said Wednesday night that the gun had not been recovered.
Deleon went before a judge early Thursday morning and was denied bond. He is being held in the Spartanburg County Detention Center.
